intro: Amygdalus divaricata, commonly known as the wild almond or rock almond, is a deciduous shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, hard seeds enclosed in a fleshy, yellowish fruit. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and historical significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
